6d5af2e6-ef42-485b-a4b5-1e1487377185 Remove jars from canner and let stand undisturbed for 12 hours.
1aa4f29a-910b-4ccf-abbe-b1ea38e42384 The flavor of apricot jam may be varied by the amount of pits used. Pits of fruits such as apricots, peaches or sour cherries impart almond like flavor not only in jams but in alcoholic infusions as well. In apricots, only the inside of the pit is used. The pits are easier to open when they are baked first. Then, the inside core of the pit is baked as well, as the pits of the above mentioned fruits contain traces of cyanide (cyanide produces almond smell). This heat treatment will prevent any allergic reaction.
1aa4f29a-910b-4ccf-abbe-b1ea38e42384 Split open apricots, save 6 pits, discard the rest. Slice apricots and place in a large bowl. Add sugar, mix, cover and leave for 4 hours at room temperature.
1aa4f29a-910b-4ccf-abbe-b1ea38e42384 Bake pits for 15 minutes on a cookie sheet at 356° F (180° C), remove from the oven, but maintain the heat. Crack shells open, remove inside cores and bake them again for 5 minutes at above temperature.
1aa4f29a-910b-4ccf-abbe-b1ea38e42384 Place apricots in a large pot, add lemon juice, and bring to a boil over medium heat.
1aa4f29a-910b-4ccf-abbe-b1ea38e42384 Continue cooking for about 15 minutes, stirring often, until jam thickens. Do not cover, the purpose of cooking is to evaporate water.
1aa4f29a-910b-4ccf-abbe-b1ea38e42384 Place one or two pits in each jar, then fill with jam to within ¼ inch from the top. Remove air bubbles, install and tighten covers.
1aa4f29a-910b-4ccf-abbe-b1ea38e42384 Place jars in a bath canner and bring water to boil. Cook for 10 minutes.
1aa4f29a-910b-4ccf-abbe-b1ea38e42384 Remove jars from the canner and leave undisturbed for 12 hours.
1aa4f29a-910b-4ccf-abbe-b1ea38e42384 Store in cool and dark place.
6cebcbf0-904c-4170-ad2d-1bf600d21278 Procedure: Wash and thoroughly crush blueberries, one layer at a time, in a saucepan. Add lemon juice, spice, and water. Stir in pectin and bring to a full rolling boil over high heat, stirring frequently. Add the sugar and return to a full rolling boil. Boil hard for 1 minute, stirring constantly. Remove from heat, quickly skim off foam, and fill sterile jars, leaving 1/4-inch headspace. Wipe rims of jars with a dampened clean paper towel. Adjust lids and process.
3b3a3049-6a1b-47a0-81c2-0981e47d35e9 Chokeberry, scientific name: Aronia melanocarpa, also known as Aronia, is blessed with unusually large number of antioxidants and vitamins. Aronia have grabbed recently the attention of food scientists as it has shown an exceptional medicinal properties. The laboratory tests have shown that aronia is effective in fighting different types of cancer, aging, neurological diseases, diabetes and many infections. Aronia is also used for making alcoholic infusions. Chokeberry contains plenty of pectin so the jam gels easily.
3b3a3049-6a1b-47a0-81c2-0981e47d35e9 Mix berries with sugar, place in pot and bring to a boil. Cook over low heat for 15 minutes stirring often. At the end of cooking add lemon juice.
3b3a3049-6a1b-47a0-81c2-0981e47d35e9 Fill jars with jam and process for 10 minutes.
0f7de2ab-1540-427e-bd80-a877cd3855b9 Black elderberry (Sumbucus nigra) has been used medicinally for hundreds of years. Many studies demonstrate that elderberry may have a measurable effect in treating the flu, alleviating allergies, and boosting overall respiratory health. Elderberry is used in Traditional Chinese Medicine, dissolved in wine,for rheumatism and traumatic injury. The berries are a favorite food resource for many birds.
0f7de2ab-1540-427e-bd80-a877cd3855b9 1. Using fork separate berries from stalks. Peel and core apple, dice into small cubes.
0f7de2ab-1540-427e-bd80-a877cd3855b9 2. Place elderberries in pot, and bring slowly to a boil, stirring constantly. Once the berries release juice, add finely diced apple. Bring to a boil.
0f7de2ab-1540-427e-bd80-a877cd3855b9 3. Decrease the heat, add sugar and lemon juice and cook over low heat for 45 minutes stirring often until the jam thickens.
0f7de2ab-1540-427e-bd80-a877cd3855b9 Perform refrigerator test.
0f7de2ab-1540-427e-bd80-a877cd3855b9 4. Fill jam into jars and process in water bath canner for 10 minutes.
0f7de2ab-1540-427e-bd80-a877cd3855b9 5. Remove jars and let stand for 12 hours.
c4c8e69d-b651-4528-90d5-1d8d929e3910 Elderberry (Sumbucus nigra) can be found in moderate climate all over the world. The berries are credited with alleviating allergies and treating the flu. The tree produces abundance of fruit and is very common in North Europe where it grows everywhere, in gardens, parks and on streets.
c4c8e69d-b651-4528-90d5-1d8d929e3910 Elderberries are commonly used in Europe to make wines, cordials, jams, fruit pies and relishes. Both, flowers and ripe berries are used for food. St. Germain, a French liqueur and Hallands Flader, a Swedish akvavit are made from elderflowers. The Italian liqueur Sambuca is flavored with elderflowers.
c4c8e69d-b651-4528-90d5-1d8d929e3910 1. Using fork separate berries from stalks. Peel and core apples, dice into small cubes.
c4c8e69d-b651-4528-90d5-1d8d929e3910 2. Place elderberries in pot, and bring slowly to a boil, stirring constantly. Once the berries release juice, add diced apples. Bring to a boil.
c4c8e69d-b651-4528-90d5-1d8d929e3910 3. Decrease the heat, add sugar and lemon juice, grated lemon zest, and cook over low heat for 40 minutes stirring often until the jam thickens.
c4c8e69d-b651-4528-90d5-1d8d929e3910 Perform refrigerator test.
c4c8e69d-b651-4528-90d5-1d8d929e3910 4. Fill jam into jars and process in water bath canner for 10 minutes.
c4c8e69d-b651-4528-90d5-1d8d929e3910 5. Remove jars and let stand for 12 hours.
2959f8b7-66b1-455b-9d0d-1f9ac4298a43 Figs are low in pectin so adding lemon will help the jam to gel.
2959f8b7-66b1-455b-9d0d-1f9ac4298a43 Place all ingredients in a bowl and leave for 4 hours.
2959f8b7-66b1-455b-9d0d-1f9ac4298a43 Bring to a boil, then cook over low heat for 45 minutes, stirring often.
2959f8b7-66b1-455b-9d0d-1f9ac4298a43 Fill into glass jars and process in a water bath canner for 10 minutes.
2959f8b7-66b1-455b-9d0d-1f9ac4298a43 Remove jars from the canner and let stand for 12 hours.
d59a3b2d-9dcf-4302-9d1e-f3ffa355fb1e Procedure:
d59a3b2d-9dcf-4302-9d1e-f3ffa355fb1e CAUTION Wear plastic or rubber gloves and do not touch your face while handling or cutting hot peppers. If you do not wear gloves, wash hands thoroughly with soap and water before touching your face or eyes.
d59a3b2d-9dcf-4302-9d1e-f3ffa355fb1e Wash all peppers thoroughly; remove stems and seeds from the peppers. Do not remove the membrane from the hot peppers, since the remaining capsaicin is located there. Place sweet and hot peppers in a blender or food processor. Add enough vinegar to puree the peppers, then puree. Combine the pepper-vinegar puree and remaining vinegar into a 6 or 8 quart saucepan. Heat to a boil; then boil 20 minutes to extract flavors and color. Remove from heat and strain through a jelly bag into a bowl. (The jelly bag is preferred; several layers of cheesecloth may also be used.) Add the strained pepper-vinegar juice back to the saucepan. Stir in sugar until dissolved and return to a boil. Add the pectin, return to a full rolling boil and boil hard for 1 minute, stirring constantly. Remove from heat, quickly skim off any foam, and fill into sterile jars, leaving 1/4-inch headspace. Wipe rims of jars with a dampened clean paper towel. Adjust lids and process.
d59a3b2d-9dcf-4302-9d1e-f3ffa355fb1e NOTE The use of yellow peppers gives this jelly a light golden color. Other colored sweet peppers can be substituted, but these will provide a different jelly color. Other hot peppers can also be substituted. It is best to start with a mild hot pepper flavor and increase it to suit personal tastes. If properly prepared, the jelly will have a mildly firm set; it is best to use half-pint jars.
be92d6c6-60e1-410f-8253-3e8e96157ce4 Procedure: Wash and pit plums; do not peel. Thoroughly crush the plums and grapes, one layer at a time, in a saucepan with water. Bring to a boil, cover, and simmer 10 minutes. Strain juice through a jelly bag or double layer of cheesecloth. Measure sugar and set aside. Combine 6-1/2 cups of juice with butter and pectin in large saucepan. Bring to a hard boil over high heat, stirring constantly. Add the sugar and return to a full rolling boil. Boil hard for 1 minute, stirring constantly. Remove from heat, quickly skim off foam, and fill sterile jars, leaving 1/4-inch headspace. Wipe rims of jars with a dampened clean paper towel. Adjust lids and process.
0745152a-a2a4-4fc1-b6a9-8314c18a8e1c Peel off peaches, remove pits and dice peaches. Place in small pot, add 3 tablespoon of water and bring to a boil. Cover the pot and cook on low heat for 10 minutes, stirring often.
0745152a-a2a4-4fc1-b6a9-8314c18a8e1c Add sugar, passion fruit pulp and vanilla. Increase heat and bring to a boil.
0745152a-a2a4-4fc1-b6a9-8314c18a8e1c Cook without cover on medium heat for 30 minutes stirring often.
0745152a-a2a4-4fc1-b6a9-8314c18a8e1c Fill jam into sterile glass jars, tighten lids and process in a water bath canner for 5 minutes.
0745152a-a2a4-4fc1-b6a9-8314c18a8e1c Remove jars from canner and let stand for 12 hours.
c0854896-0ac3-4849-a2ab-918bfc8d91ee The flavor of peach jam may be varied by keeping some of the pits. Pits of fruits such as apricots, peaches or sour cherries introduce a hint of almond flavor. In peaches, the pits are large and not easy to crack, however, the task becomes easier after they are baked first. Then, the inside core of the pit is baked and added to jams. The pits of the above mentioned fruits contain traces of cyanide (cyanide produces almond smell). This heat treatment takes care of any allergic reaction.
c0854896-0ac3-4849-a2ab-918bfc8d91ee Split open peaches, save 6 pits, discard the rest. Slice peaches and place in a large bowl. Add sugar, mix, cover and leave for 4 hours at room temperature.
c0854896-0ac3-4849-a2ab-918bfc8d91ee Bake pits for 15 minutes on a cookie sheet at 356° F (180° C), remove from the oven, but maintain the heat. Crack shells open, remove inside cores and bake them again for 5 minutes at above temperature.
c0854896-0ac3-4849-a2ab-918bfc8d91ee Place peaches in a large pot, add lemon juice, and bring to a boil over medium heat.
c0854896-0ac3-4849-a2ab-918bfc8d91ee Continue cooking for about 15 minutes, stirring often, until jam thickens. Do not cover, the purpose of cooking is to evaporate water.
c0854896-0ac3-4849-a2ab-918bfc8d91ee Place one or two pits in each jar, then fill with jam to within ¼ inch from the top. Remove air bubbles, install and tighten covers.
c0854896-0ac3-4849-a2ab-918bfc8d91ee Place jars in a bath canner and bring water to boil. Cook for 10 minutes.
c0854896-0ac3-4849-a2ab-918bfc8d91ee Remove jars from the canner and leave undisturbed for 12 hours.
c0854896-0ac3-4849-a2ab-918bfc8d91ee Store in cool and dark place.
8e466f19-5099-457b-8d03-c3f4eb4e1be0 Any plum will make a good jam, however, damson plums are our favorite for making jams or alcoholic beverages.
8e466f19-5099-457b-8d03-c3f4eb4e1be0 Split open plums, remove pits. Quarter plums and place in a large bowl. Add sugar, mix, cover and leave for 4 hours at room temperature.
8e466f19-5099-457b-8d03-c3f4eb4e1be0 Place plums in a large pot, add lemon juice, and bring to a boil over medium heat.
8e466f19-5099-457b-8d03-c3f4eb4e1be0 Continue cooking for about 10-15 minutes, stirring often, until jam thickens. Do not cover, the purpose of cooking is to evaporate water. Perform refrigerator test to test jam.
8e466f19-5099-457b-8d03-c3f4eb4e1be0 Fill jars with jam to within ¼ inch from the top. Remove air bubbles, install and tighten covers.
8e466f19-5099-457b-8d03-c3f4eb4e1be0 Place jars in a bath canner and bring water to a boil. Cook for 10 minutes.
8e466f19-5099-457b-8d03-c3f4eb4e1be0 Remove jars from the canner and leave undisturbed for 12 hours.
8e466f19-5099-457b-8d03-c3f4eb4e1be0 Store in cool and dark place.
5041de5f-be84-4f70-a4e6-9aba8dd4912d Quinces are pectin rich and create easily gelling jams with other fruits.
5041de5f-be84-4f70-a4e6-9aba8dd4912d Wipe off little hairs, wash and quarter quinces. Discard the blossom ends, peel the skin off, remove cores and seeds, but do not throw away. Wash and quarter pears, discard the stems and blossom ends, peel off the skin, remove cores and seeds, save. Slice quince and pears quarters thinly.
5041de5f-be84-4f70-a4e6-9aba8dd4912d Liquid pectin. Place the skins, cores and seeds from quinces and pears in pot, adda little water (do not cover with water), bring to boil and simmer for 20 minutes. Strain and save the liquid for later.
5041de5f-be84-4f70-a4e6-9aba8dd4912d Place sliced quinces in a large pot, add a little water and bring to a boil over medium heat.
5041de5f-be84-4f70-a4e6-9aba8dd4912d Add cinnamon stick, cloves, diced ginger, lemon zest and continue cooking over low fire for 15 minutes, stirring often. Add sliced pears, sugar and lemon juice and continue cooking for 25 minutes.
5041de5f-be84-4f70-a4e6-9aba8dd4912d Add the liquid pectin (see step 2) and cook for 5 minutes more. Perform refrigerator test to test jam.
5041de5f-be84-4f70-a4e6-9aba8dd4912d Fill jars with jam to within ¼ inch from the top. Remove air bubbles, install and tighten covers.
5041de5f-be84-4f70-a4e6-9aba8dd4912d Place jars in a bath canner and bring water to a boil. Cook for 10 minutes.
5041de5f-be84-4f70-a4e6-9aba8dd4912d Remove jars from the canner and leave undisturbed for 12 hours.
5041de5f-be84-4f70-a4e6-9aba8dd4912d Store in cool and dark place.
9b6323fe-db6d-471b-96d2-1dfcdeb61756 Being pectin rich, the quinces gel easily and are used to make jam, jelly and quince pudding, or they may be peeled, then roasted, baked or stewed. The flesh of the fruit turns red after a long cooking time. The fruit is hard, astringent and sour to eat raw and must be cooked to be edible. Quince produces a wonderful combination when mixed with sugar. The quince is a small tree that bears a pome fruit, similar in appearance to a pear and apple, and is bright golden-yellow when mature.
9b6323fe-db6d-471b-96d2-1dfcdeb61756 Wipe off little hairs, wash and quarter quinces. Discard the blossom ends. Peel the skin off, remove cores and seeds, but do not throw away. Slice the fruit thinly.
9b6323fe-db6d-471b-96d2-1dfcdeb61756 Liquid pectin. Place the skins, cores and seeds in pot, add a little water (do not cover with water), bring to a boil and simmer for 20 minutes. Strain and save the liquid for later.
9b6323fe-db6d-471b-96d2-1dfcdeb61756 Place sliced quinces in a large pot, add a little water and bring to a boil over medium heat.
9b6323fe-db6d-471b-96d2-1dfcdeb61756 Add cinnamon stick, cloves, diced ginger, lemon zest and continue cooking over low fire for 15 minutes, stirring often. Add sugar and lemon juice and continue cooking for 25 minutes.
9b6323fe-db6d-471b-96d2-1dfcdeb61756 Add the liquid pectin (see step 2) and cook for 5 minutes more. Perform refrigerator test to test jam.
9b6323fe-db6d-471b-96d2-1dfcdeb61756 Fill jars with jam to within ¼ inch from the top. Remove air bubbles, install and tighten covers.
9b6323fe-db6d-471b-96d2-1dfcdeb61756 Place jars in a bath canner and bring water to a boil. Cook for 10 minutes.
9b6323fe-db6d-471b-96d2-1dfcdeb61756 Remove jars from the canner and leave undisturbed for 12 hours.
9b6323fe-db6d-471b-96d2-1dfcdeb61756 Store in cool and dark place.
1ce984a0-2c05-4318-9266-845b1f56f108 Raspberry jam is used in cakes, pastries, ice creams and sandwiches.
1ce984a0-2c05-4318-9266-845b1f56f108 Mix gently raspberries with sugar in a large bowl, cover and leave for 3 hours at room temperature.
1ce984a0-2c05-4318-9266-845b1f56f108 Place raspberries in a large pot, add lemon juice, cover the pot and bring to a boil over medium heat.
1ce984a0-2c05-4318-9266-845b1f56f108 Lower the heat, remove cover and cook for 10 minutes stirring often.
1ce984a0-2c05-4318-9266-845b1f56f108 Take the jam off the heat and perform the refrigerator test to see if it is ready.
1ce984a0-2c05-4318-9266-845b1f56f108 Fill glass jars with hot jam to within ¼ inch from the top. Remove air bubbles and wipe off the jar rim. Install and tighten the cover.
1ce984a0-2c05-4318-9266-845b1f56f108 Place jars in a bath canner and bring water to boil. Cook for 10 minutes.
1ce984a0-2c05-4318-9266-845b1f56f108 Remove jars from the canner and leave undisturbed for 12 hours.
1ce984a0-2c05-4318-9266-845b1f56f108 Store in cool and dark place.
61170516-b6fd-4eef-a2d2-f0d4a491a016 Procedure: In a saucepan, soften the gelatin in the apple and lemon juices. To dissolve gelatin, bring to a full rolling boil and boil 2 minutes. Remove from heat. Stir in sweetener and food coloring, if desired. Fill jars, leaving 1/4 inch headspace. Wipe rims of jars with a dampened clean paper towel. Adjust lids. Do not process or freeze.
61170516-b6fd-4eef-a2d2-f0d4a491a016 CAUTION Store in refrigerator and use within 4 weeks.
61170516-b6fd-4eef-a2d2-f0d4a491a016 Optional: For spiced apple jelly, add 2 sticks of cinnamon and 4 whole cloves to mixture before boiling. Remove both spices before adding the sweetener and food coloring.
1a3dabc7-20a9-4ae9-ae89-0942057eeeec Procedure: In a saucepan, soften the gelatin in the grape and lemon juices. Bring to a full rolling boil to dissolve gelatin. Boil 1 minute and remove from heat. Stir in sweetener. Fill hot jars quickly, leaving 1/4 inch headspace. Wipe rims of jars with a dampened clean paper towel. Adjust lids. Do not process or freeze.
1a3dabc7-20a9-4ae9-ae89-0942057eeeec CAUTION Store in refrigerator and use within 4 weeks.
5327ee17-f2da-42d0-bd9b-77b973e15bc3 Sweet cherries contain more pectin than sweet cherries, but will turn out best when made with additional pectin.
5327ee17-f2da-42d0-bd9b-77b973e15bc3 Remove stems and pits, smash or cut sour cherries into smaller pieces.
5327ee17-f2da-42d0-bd9b-77b973e15bc3 Combine sour cherries with Ball® RealFruit™ Classic Pectin. Add ¼ tsp butter or margarine to prevent foaming (optional). Bring mixture to a full rolling boil, stirring continuously.
5327ee17-f2da-42d0-bd9b-77b973e15bc3 Add sugar and stir to dissolve. Bring mixture to a full boil and boil for 1 minute, stirring continuously. Remove from heat and skim foam, if any.
5327ee17-f2da-42d0-bd9b-77b973e15bc3 Fill jam into glass jars and process for 10 minutes in a water bath canner.
5327ee17-f2da-42d0-bd9b-77b973e15bc3 Remove jars and let stand for 12 hours.
621bd773-4b3d-47d4-889b-93184086f992 Strawberry jam is the most popular jam in the world. It can be made from strawberries only or with other fruits like sour cherries or rhubarb. The texture and sweetness of the jam depends on the amount of sugar, the more sugar the thicker the jam.
621bd773-4b3d-47d4-889b-93184086f992 Wash strawberries and remove the stems. Cut large strawberries in half, quarter the small ones.
621bd773-4b3d-47d4-889b-93184086f992 Mix strawberries with sugar in a large bowl, cover and leave for 3 hours at room temperature.
621bd773-4b3d-47d4-889b-93184086f992 Place strawberries in a large pot, add lemon juice, cover and bring to a boil over medium heat.
621bd773-4b3d-47d4-889b-93184086f992 Lower the heat, remove cover and cook for about 30 minutes stirring often. Discard foam from the top.
621bd773-4b3d-47d4-889b-93184086f992 Take the jam off the heat and perform the refrigerator test to see if it is ready.
621bd773-4b3d-47d4-889b-93184086f992 Fill glass jars with hot jam to within ¼ inch from the top. Remove air bubbles and wipe off the jar rim. Install and tighten the cover.
621bd773-4b3d-47d4-889b-93184086f992 Place jars in a bath canner and bring water to boil. Cook for 10 minutes.
621bd773-4b3d-47d4-889b-93184086f992 Remove jars from the canner and leave undisturbed for 12 hours.
621bd773-4b3d-47d4-889b-93184086f992 Store in cool and dark place.
8ee07288-7b92-46d4-9c53-e18dccc46c1e Very simple and fast to make strawberry jam made using Ball® RealFruit® Classic Pectin.
8ee07288-7b92-46d4-9c53-e18dccc46c1e Remove caps and mash strawberries using a potato masher.
8ee07288-7b92-46d4-9c53-e18dccc46c1e Mix strawberries, lemon juice and sugar in a bowl. Let stand for 10 minutes.
8ee07288-7b92-46d4-9c53-e18dccc46c1e Add dry pectin to water, bring to a boil and boil for 1 minute continuing to stir.
8ee07288-7b92-46d4-9c53-e18dccc46c1e Pour pectin over strawberries and mix. Continue stirring for 3 minutes.
8ee07288-7b92-46d4-9c53-e18dccc46c1e Fill jam into clean jars leaving ½ inch headspace. Tighten covers and let jam to set at room temperature for up to 24 hours.
8ee07288-7b92-46d4-9c53-e18dccc46c1e Refrigerate up to 3 weeks or freeze up to 1 year.
6901d846-fbe3-4afc-9a39-41602b1d7d19 Procedure: Wash and cut rhubarb into 1-inch pieces and blend or grind. Wash, stem, and crush strawberries, one layer at a time, in a saucepan. Place both fruits in a jelly bag or double layer of cheesecloth and gently squeeze out juice. Measure 3-1/2 cups of juice into a large saucepan. Add butter and sugar, thoroughly mixing into juice. Bring to a boil over high heat, stirring constantly. Immediately stir in pectin. Bring to a full rolling boil and boil hard 1 minute, stirring constantly. Remove from heat, quickly skim off foam, and fill sterile jars, leaving 1/4-inch headspace. Wipe rims of jars with a dampened clean paper towel. Adjust lids and process.
85e45c0b-d2f0-448e-937f-f47e9f16a7a1 Sweet cherries are best made with added pectin and lemon juice as they contain very little natural pectin.
85e45c0b-d2f0-448e-937f-f47e9f16a7a1 Remove stems and pits, smash or cut cherries into smaller pieces.
85e45c0b-d2f0-448e-937f-f47e9f16a7a1 Combine cherries and lemon juice, stir in Ball® RealFruit™ Classic Pectin. Add ¼ tsp butter or margarine to prevent foaming (optional). Bring mixture to a full rolling boil, stirring continuously.
85e45c0b-d2f0-448e-937f-f47e9f16a7a1 Add sugar and stir to dissolve. Bring mixture to a full boil and boil for 1 minute, stirring continuously. Remove from heat and skim foam, if any.
85e45c0b-d2f0-448e-937f-f47e9f16a7a1 Fill jam into glass jars and process for 10 minutes in a water bath canner.
85e45c0b-d2f0-448e-937f-f47e9f16a7a1 Remove jars and let stand for 12 hours.
794a58d5-4808-402e-ac6b-29ec796f49ec Use Jonathan, Winesap, Stayman, Golden Delicious, Macintosh, or other tasty apple varieties for good results.
794a58d5-4808-402e-ac6b-29ec796f49ec Yield: About 8 to 9 pints
794a58d5-4808-402e-ac6b-29ec796f49ec Procedure: Wash, remove stems, quarter, and core fruit. Cook slowly in cider and vinegar until soft. Press fruit through a colander, food mill, or strainer. Cook fruit pulp with sugar and spices, stirring frequently. To test for doneness, remove a spoonful and hold it away from steam for 2 minutes. It is done if the butter remains mounded on the spoon. Another way to determine when the butter is cooked adequately is to spoon a small quantity onto a plate. When a rim of liquid does not separate around the edge of the butter, it is ready for canning. Fill hot into sterile half-pint or pint jars, leaving 1/4 inch headspace. Quart jars need not be presterilized but should be clean and kept hot until filling. Remove air bubbles and adjust headspace if needed. Wipe rims of jars with a dampened clean paper towel. Adjust lids and process.
6b685b9e-4fdd-4cb4-9ccf-7350d77068bd Apple butter is made with apples, cider and aromatic spices. Many recipes include vinegar. Making apple butter and apple sauce is similar, however, butter is much thicker.
6b685b9e-4fdd-4cb4-9ccf-7350d77068bd 1. Remove stems, quarter and core apples. Cut apples into smaller pieces. You can peel the apples or leave the skin on. The skin will be removed during straining step.
6b685b9e-4fdd-4cb4-9ccf-7350d77068bd 2. Place diced apples and apple cider in pot. Cook slowly on a low heat for about one hour, until apples are soft.
6b685b9e-4fdd-4cb4-9ccf-7350d77068bd 3. Strain through a strainer. Discard skins if present.
6b685b9e-4fdd-4cb4-9ccf-7350d77068bd 4. Cook apple pulp with sugar, stirring frequently.
6b685b9e-4fdd-4cb4-9ccf-7350d77068bd 5. Add spices at the final stage of cooking.
6b685b9e-4fdd-4cb4-9ccf-7350d77068bd 6. Meanwhile, sterilize canning jars.
6b685b9e-4fdd-4cb4-9ccf-7350d77068bd 7. Test for doneness:
6b685b9e-4fdd-4cb4-9ccf-7350d77068bd 8. Fill hot butter into jars, leaving ¼” headspace. Wipe jar rims and adjust lids.
6b685b9e-4fdd-4cb4-9ccf-7350d77068bd 9. Process for 5 minutes in a boiling water bath.
e437563f-ed4e-42d2-a6c7-b10bd0785f8f Apple fruit leather can be made from fresh apples or apple sauce. Canned apple sauce can be mixed with more expensive berries to make more fruit leather. It is hard to obtain liquefied apple in a blender or processor so it is best to pre-cook apples in a pot until they are soft. Then, they can be easily liquefied in a blender.
e437563f-ed4e-42d2-a6c7-b10bd0785f8f 1. Peel, core and dice apples.
e437563f-ed4e-42d2-a6c7-b10bd0785f8f 2. Cook apples until soft.
e437563f-ed4e-42d2-a6c7-b10bd0785f8f 3. Puree apple pulp in a blender. Add sugar and cinnamon.
e437563f-ed4e-42d2-a6c7-b10bd0785f8f 4. Pour fruit apple onto parchment sheet.
e437563f-ed4e-42d2-a6c7-b10bd0785f8f 5. Dry at 140° F (40° C) until done.
e437563f-ed4e-42d2-a6c7-b10bd0785f8f Testing. Test fruit leather by pressing against with your finger. Properly dried fruit leather is slightly tacky to touch, but easily peeled from the sheet. There should not be visible indentation. Cool the leather for 10 minutes, then peel away and roll. Properly dried leather will unwrap easily, the still moist spots will stick to the sheet. Wrap the fruit roll in plastic.
a9d04a94-1055-4dbb-8b38-424ac628265b Mixing plum or plum butter with chocolate creates a wonderful combination. Addingorange flavor rounds up the flavor. Commercial chocolates are often made with plums, cherries or oranges, and such combination work well with butters as well.
a9d04a94-1055-4dbb-8b38-424ac628265b 1. Soak dry plums for 6-12 hours in water. They will absorb water and expand in volume.
a9d04a94-1055-4dbb-8b38-424ac628265b 2. Blend soaked plums in food processor.
a9d04a94-1055-4dbb-8b38-424ac628265b 3. Add cinnamon, lemon juice, lemon zest, orange zest and cook with plum pulp on low heat stirring often. After 30 minutes test for doneness:
a9d04a94-1055-4dbb-8b38-424ac628265b 4. Add orange extract and mix the butter. Pack in clean jars and process for 10 minutes in a boiling water canner.
a9d04a94-1055-4dbb-8b38-424ac628265b NOTE instead semi-sweet chocolate chips, you may add 226 g (8 oz) of Nestle pure cocoa and 100 g (3.5 oz) sugar.
2afe9c66-7bf5-4d08-862f-015465760121 Peach butter is delicious and fast to make.
2afe9c66-7bf5-4d08-862f-015465760121 Wash, scald, pit and peel peaches. Cut into smaller pieces.
2afe9c66-7bf5-4d08-862f-015465760121 Start cooking peaches on low heat to release juice. Cook until soft.
2afe9c66-7bf5-4d08-862f-015465760121 Strain through a sieve.
2afe9c66-7bf5-4d08-862f-015465760121 Add sugar and cook the pulp, stirring often for about 45 minutes.
2afe9c66-7bf5-4d08-862f-015465760121 Fill butter into sterilized jars, leaving ¼ inch headspace.
2afe9c66-7bf5-4d08-862f-015465760121 Process for 5 minutes in a boiling water bath. Wipe off jar rims and tighten lids.
2afe9c66-7bf5-4d08-862f-015465760121 Remove jars and let stand for 6 hours.
7bea8ab2-8cb7-40e3-836c-f4a151f39267 Plum butter can be spread on a roll or served like a jam. Very sweet butters are usually spread thinly and those with little sugar can be served in bigger portions.
7bea8ab2-8cb7-40e3-836c-f4a151f39267 1. Wash plums, split and discard pits. Cut the plums into smaller pieces.
7bea8ab2-8cb7-40e3-836c-f4a151f39267 2. Add lemon juice and cook the plums until soft, stirring often. Start on very low heat until plums release juice.
7bea8ab2-8cb7-40e3-836c-f4a151f39267 3. Strain the pulp through a strainer.
7bea8ab2-8cb7-40e3-836c-f4a151f39267 4. Add sugar and cinnamon. Cook the pulp, stirring more often until proper texture is obtained.
7bea8ab2-8cb7-40e3-836c-f4a151f39267 Test for doneness: place a small quantity of the butter on a plate. When a rim of the liquid does not separate around the edge of the butter, it is done.
7bea8ab2-8cb7-40e3-836c-f4a151f39267 5. Fill sterilized jars with hot prune butter and tighten the lid.
7bea8ab2-8cb7-40e3-836c-f4a151f39267 6. Process for 10 minutes in a boiling water bath canner.
7bea8ab2-8cb7-40e3-836c-f4a151f39267 7. Remove jars and leave undisturbed for 12 hours.
7bea8ab2-8cb7-40e3-836c-f4a151f39267 NOTE plum butter does not need much sugar, taste it and decide whether it is sweet enough.
9dfcedd1-782a-468a-8edd-a8b65a838127 Prune butter from dry prunes has a strong flavor and is faster to make than using fresh plums. Sugar is often left out as prune butter tastes delicious without it.
9dfcedd1-782a-468a-8edd-a8b65a838127 1. Soak the prunes for 12 hours in water. They will absorb water and expand in volume.
9dfcedd1-782a-468a-8edd-a8b65a838127 2. Cook the prunes until soft.
9dfcedd1-782a-468a-8edd-a8b65a838127 3. Strain the pulp and juice through a medium size sieve.
9dfcedd1-782a-468a-8edd-a8b65a838127 4. Place in a large pot and bring to a boil. Continue cooking at low heat, stirring often.
9dfcedd1-782a-468a-8edd-a8b65a838127 5. Add cinnamon and keep on cooking. Test for doneness: place a small quantity of the butter on a plate. When a rim of the liquid does not separate around the edge ofthe butter, it is done.
9dfcedd1-782a-468a-8edd-a8b65a838127 6. Fill sterilized jars with hot prune butter and tighten the lid.
9dfcedd1-782a-468a-8edd-a8b65a838127 7. Process for 10 minutes in a boiling water bath canner.
9dfcedd1-782a-468a-8edd-a8b65a838127 8. Remove jars and leave undisturbed for 12 hours.
9dfcedd1-782a-468a-8edd-a8b65a838127 NOTE adding sugar is optional. About 50 g (2 oz) is plenty.
9dfcedd1-782a-468a-8edd-a8b65a838127 A. Soak prunes for 12 hours.
9dfcedd1-782a-468a-8edd-a8b65a838127 B. Blend prunes in a food processor.
9dfcedd1-782a-468a-8edd-a8b65a838127 C. Add cinnamon and cook on low heat stirring often. After 30 minutes test for doneness: place a small quantity of the butter on a plate. When a rim of the liquid does not separate around the edge of the butter, it is done.
9dfcedd1-782a-468a-8edd-a8b65a838127 D. Pack in clean jars and process for 10 minutes in a boiling water canner.
8823dddb-cc97-4a12-926b-5f2d3906f476 Strawberries make delicious fruit leather.
8823dddb-cc97-4a12-926b-5f2d3906f476 1. Wash strawberries, remove green tops and cut strawberries into halves. Smash strawberries with potato masher.
8823dddb-cc97-4a12-926b-5f2d3906f476 2. Puree strawberries in a blender. Add sugar.
8823dddb-cc97-4a12-926b-5f2d3906f476 3. Pour strawberry fruit leather onto parchment sheet.
8823dddb-cc97-4a12-926b-5f2d3906f476 4. Dry at 140° F (40° C) until done. Testing. Test fruit leather by pressing against with your finger. Properly dried fruit leather is slightly tacky to touch, but easily peeled from the sheet.
8823dddb-cc97-4a12-926b-5f2d3906f476 There should not be visible indentation. Cool the leather for 10 minutes, then peel away and roll. Properly dried fruit leather will unwrap easily, the still moist spots willstick to the sheet. Wrap the fruit roll in plastic.
372b6975-a7bf-4079-9e9b-ee6e6df175b8 Trim off outer leaves, split cabbage into quarters, then cut into 1î (2.5 cm) slices. Slice carrot into 1/4î (5 mm) slices.
372b6975-a7bf-4079-9e9b-ee6e6df175b8 Make a brine: 3 cups salt to 4 quarts water. Brine the cabbage and carrots for 3 hours. Remove cabbage and carrots, save the brine. Rinse in fresh water, drain, repeat twice more. Drain cabbage for 30 minutes.
372b6975-a7bf-4079-9e9b-ee6e6df175b8 Cut scallions diagonally into 1î (2.5 cm) pieces.
372b6975-a7bf-4079-9e9b-ee6e6df175b8 Finely dice ginger and mix with red pepper powder.
372b6975-a7bf-4079-9e9b-ee6e6df175b8 Mix all together.
372b6975-a7bf-4079-9e9b-ee6e6df175b8 Pack the mixture in a container. Put on top outer leaves that were removed in step #1. Sprinkle with salt. Place weight on top. Add enough leftover brine to submerge the mixture. Ferment 3 days.
9b84e24b-ecb0-43fb-b117-dfa4a91df780 Wash radishes, clean the skin gently with a sponge, don't use a brush. Cut half of the radishes into 2" long sections. Make vertical criss-cross cuts at 3/4" intervals. Stop cutting at about 1/2" (1 cm) from the bottom. Cut the remaining radishes into thin 2" long Julienne strips.
9b84e24b-ecb0-43fb-b117-dfa4a91df780 Soften radish by placing it for 3 hours in brine, that is made by dissolving 3 cups of salt (864 g) in 4 quarts (~ 4 liters) of water. Drain, rinse in fresh water, then drain again.
9b84e24b-ecb0-43fb-b117-dfa4a91df780 Mix miso, honey, red pepper powder, garlic and ginger. Use garlic press to squash ginger and garlic.
9b84e24b-ecb0-43fb-b117-dfa4a91df780 Spread the cut, insert a toothpick to keep it open and fill crevices with paste. Remove the toothpick and repeat the procedure at the next cut.
9b84e24b-ecb0-43fb-b117-dfa4a91df780 Cut the Korean pear into thin strips. Mix with dry cranberries and radish strips.
9b84e24b-ecb0-43fb-b117-dfa4a91df780 Place all strips on the bottom of a container and sprinkle salt over them. Mix. Place round sections of radishes on top.
9b84e24b-ecb0-43fb-b117-dfa4a91df780 Cover with cabbage leaves or inverted glass plate and apply some weight. You may fill a ZiplockÆ bag with brine and put it on top.
9b84e24b-ecb0-43fb-b117-dfa4a91df780 Ferment 3 days.
61501c99-ea0b-45f7-afdd-decb0a503640 Trim off outer leaves, split cabbage into separate halves.
61501c99-ea0b-45f7-afdd-decb0a503640 Make a brine: 3 cups salt to 4 quarts water. Brine the cabbage for 3 hours. Rinse cabbage in fresh water and squeeze the water out, repeat twice more. Drain cabbage for 30 minutes.
61501c99-ea0b-45f7-afdd-decb0a503640 Cut cabbage into 2î (5 cm) sections.
61501c99-ea0b-45f7-afdd-decb0a503640 Add a little water to red pepper powder and make paste.
61501c99-ea0b-45f7-afdd-decb0a503640 Cut scallions diagonally, dice ginger and crush garlic.
61501c99-ea0b-45f7-afdd-decb0a503640 Add salt and sugar and mix all together.
61501c99-ea0b-45f7-afdd-decb0a503640 Pack stuffed cabbage in a container. Put on top outer leaves that were removed in step #1. Sprinkle with salt. Place weight on top. Ferment 3 days.
2dd85a55-094a-4cf1-b8d6-ee2b4b029e05 Beets rich chemical and mineral composition has made them a medicinal vegetable for thousands of years. Beets are rich in nitrates and when consumed regularly, they help to lower blood pressure and stimulate the immune system. Beet juice is a powerful natural colorant.
2dd85a55-094a-4cf1-b8d6-ee2b4b029e05 Cut off stalks and rinse beets off to get rid of dirt. Don't scrub the outside or peel the beets.
2dd85a55-094a-4cf1-b8d6-ee2b4b029e05 Slice or grate beets. Cut pears into wedges.
2dd85a55-094a-4cf1-b8d6-ee2b4b029e05 Mix with salt and spices.
2dd85a55-094a-4cf1-b8d6-ee2b4b029e05 Pack. Place a weight on top. Beets may get foamy, this is normal.
2dd85a55-094a-4cf1-b8d6-ee2b4b029e05 Ferment, preferably around 68° F (20° C), for about 2 weeks. After 3 days, taste the beets and see how you like them. If you want them a little tangier, let them ferment longer. If you like what you taste, refrigerate.
fd42354d-7c0e-4d4c-bc2a-5d0a3b781db1 Finely grated fresh beets and horseradish is a great combination that goes well with cold meat cuts. Horseradish is a root crop, grown for the pungent roots. They contain highly volatile oils with a sharp flavor. Grind fresh horseradish in a well-ventilated room. The fumes from grinding are potent. If you use a manual grater expect to cry a lot! Beets will color your hands purple, so use gloves.
fd42354d-7c0e-4d4c-bc2a-5d0a3b781db1 Wash and rinse beets to get rid of dirt but don't scrub the outside or peel them. Slice or grate.
fd42354d-7c0e-4d4c-bc2a-5d0a3b781db1 Do the same with horseradish.
fd42354d-7c0e-4d4c-bc2a-5d0a3b781db1 Mix everything with spices, salt and sugar.
fd42354d-7c0e-4d4c-bc2a-5d0a3b781db1 Pack in a container. Place weight on top.
fd42354d-7c0e-4d4c-bc2a-5d0a3b781db1 Ferment, preferably around 68° F (20° C), for about 2 weeks. Serve with lemon wedges.
9624d729-ad6d-4b4a-b8de-f5153472d034 Borscht is a beet soup of Ukrainian (борщ) origin. In Russian it is spelled the same way (борщ) and in Poland it is known as barszcz. It is pronounced almost the same in most Eastern and Central European countries so there is no question where borsch comes from. Borsch was always popular among Jews who added letter “t” at the end and it is known as borscht in the US.
9624d729-ad6d-4b4a-b8de-f5153472d034 There is a hot and cold version of borscht and both versions are made by cooking beets what deprives them of many beneficial nutrients. You can, however, skip cooking beets altogether and ferment them instead. Red beets ferment easily and are delicious, so it should not come as a surprise that borscht can be made without cooking, by fermentation alone.
9624d729-ad6d-4b4a-b8de-f5153472d034 This fermented beet base can be used for many dishes:
9624d729-ad6d-4b4a-b8de-f5153472d034 You can use it to make delicious Lithuanian Beet Cooler Soup without cooking preserving all nutrients and vitamins.
9624d729-ad6d-4b4a-b8de-f5153472d034 NOTE beets and beet juice are rich in nitrates and are credited with lowering blood pressure when consumed on a regular basis. They help to detoxify the liver.
9624d729-ad6d-4b4a-b8de-f5153472d034 After a week fermented beets and juice have enough acidity to make uncooked borscht or delicious Lithuanian Beet Cooler Soup.
9624d729-ad6d-4b4a-b8de-f5153472d034 The advantage of using fermented beets for making soups is that there is no cooking involved and all vitamins and nutrients are preserved. Fermented beets are softer and the juice tastes perfect. You can think of fermented beet borscht as a soup stock which can be enriched with additional ingredients.
9624d729-ad6d-4b4a-b8de-f5153472d034 Make brine by dissolving salt in water.
9624d729-ad6d-4b4a-b8de-f5153472d034 Wash beets and peel off the skin. Cut into discs or dice them.
9624d729-ad6d-4b4a-b8de-f5153472d034 Peel of horseradish and garlic. Cut horseradish and dill into smaller sections.
9624d729-ad6d-4b4a-b8de-f5153472d034 Place beets in a glass jar, add horseradish, garlic and dill.
9624d729-ad6d-4b4a-b8de-f5153472d034 Fill with brine, place the lid and tighten. Let it ferment at room temperature for at least one week. You can eat itat any time, but in 4 days it develops its real character.
9624d729-ad6d-4b4a-b8de-f5153472d034 For longer storage place fermented borscht in refrigerator.
c9fd34e6-cfe4-4328-9c66-0a857d64fd92 Fermented cucumbers are made from small hard cucumbers, mature dill, horseradish and salty water. Pack all ingredients tight in a jar so they will be fully covered in brine and the rest is easy.
c9fd34e6-cfe4-4328-9c66-0a857d64fd92 You can vary the amount of salt in brine:
c9fd34e6-cfe4-4328-9c66-0a857d64fd92 Depending on your preference, fermented cucumbers are ready to consume in 3-4 days or wait longer for more acidic taste. Naturally fermented cucumbers are made without vinegar and are meant to be consumed in a relatively short time. When desired acidity is obtained, place jar in refrigerator to stop fermentation. Many people like to drink cucumber juice which is quite delicious. Naturally fermented cucumbers have little in common with loaded with vinegar commercial product.
c9fd34e6-cfe4-4328-9c66-0a857d64fd92 Wash cucumbers, scrape the ends with fingernail. Those areas contain most of bacteria. Some people cut the end off, but there is no need for that.
c9fd34e6-cfe4-4328-9c66-0a857d64fd92 Peel off garlic and horseradish. Cut up horseradish and dill.
c9fd34e6-cfe4-4328-9c66-0a857d64fd92 Place dill on the bottom, then fit cucumbers vertically as tight as possible. Fit garlic and dill stems into open spaces.
c9fd34e6-cfe4-4328-9c66-0a857d64fd92 Mix salt with water and fill the jar with brine. If cucumbers are packed tight they will be completely submerged in brine.
c9fd34e6-cfe4-4328-9c66-0a857d64fd92 Ferment at room temperature. They will be ready to eat in 3 days.
657092f7-0817-4d13-a365-6303d64d40e3 Fermented tomatoes can be served with sandwiches, salads or with the main dish.
657092f7-0817-4d13-a365-6303d64d40e3 Wash tomatoes and place them in clay crock or food grade plastic container.
657092f7-0817-4d13-a365-6303d64d40e3 Add water and all ingredients. Cover.
657092f7-0817-4d13-a365-6303d64d40e3 Ferment for at least one week at room temperature.
657092f7-0817-4d13-a365-6303d64d40e3 Store in refrigerator.
f0abdef7-12a6-4498-b3bc-0147a00d94c6 Peel off garlic cloves.
f0abdef7-12a6-4498-b3bc-0147a00d94c6 Mix miso with wine to make a paste.
f0abdef7-12a6-4498-b3bc-0147a00d94c6 Place some of the miso mixtrue in a jar, then add garlic.
f0abdef7-12a6-4498-b3bc-0147a00d94c6 Cover garlic with a new layer of miso.
f0abdef7-12a6-4498-b3bc-0147a00d94c6 Repeat the procedure until all garlic cloves are covered with miso.
f0abdef7-12a6-4498-b3bc-0147a00d94c6 Close the jar and refrigerate.
134a14e3-352d-445f-9a8e-7f31ebc53672 Remove outer leaves.
134a14e3-352d-445f-9a8e-7f31ebc53672 Cut cabbage in quarters, remove cores. They may be finely grated and added as well. Cut apples into 6 wedges, discard stems and seeds.
134a14e3-352d-445f-9a8e-7f31ebc53672 Mix cabbage, apples, cranberries, salt and pack tightly in a container.
134a14e3-352d-445f-9a8e-7f31ebc53672 Cover with leaves and apply weight.
134a14e3-352d-445f-9a8e-7f31ebc53672 Ferment, preferably around 68° F (20° C), for about 3 weeks.
e56d23f7-2cf7-4e17-921b-aecf3b6fd36f Remove 2-3 outer cabbage leaves for later use. Cut the cabbage half way from the base to the middle.
e56d23f7-2cf7-4e17-921b-aecf3b6fd36f Tear the rest apart.
e56d23f7-2cf7-4e17-921b-aecf3b6fd36f Split each half into quarters.
e56d23f7-2cf7-4e17-921b-aecf3b6fd36f Sprinkle little salt into the bottom of a container.
e56d23f7-2cf7-4e17-921b-aecf3b6fd36f Place cabbage quarters, cut sides up. Sprinkle more salt on cut cabbage, add lemon slices, kombu, and whole hot peppers.
e56d23f7-2cf7-4e17-921b-aecf3b6fd36f Repeat until all cabbage is firmly packed. Sprinkle with remaining salt.
e56d23f7-2cf7-4e17-921b-aecf3b6fd36f Place a lid or inverted dinner plate on top of cabbage, then add weight on top.
e56d23f7-2cf7-4e17-921b-aecf3b6fd36f There should be liquid over the plate the next day. Ready to eat in 3 days.
0f741c9b-4a64-4004-aa71-45a1fadb6ab1 Remove 2-3 outer cabbage leaves for later use. Cut the cabbage into 6-8 wedges. Don't remove the core, just trim off the tough part. The core holds the leaves together.
0f741c9b-4a64-4004-aa71-45a1fadb6ab1 Sprinkle a little salt into the bottom of the container or a bowl.
0f741c9b-4a64-4004-aa71-45a1fadb6ab1 Place cabbage wedges, cut sides up. Sprinkle more salt on cabbage.
0f741c9b-4a64-4004-aa71-45a1fadb6ab1 Pour over 1/2 cup (120 ml) of water.
0f741c9b-4a64-4004-aa71-45a1fadb6ab1 Place a lid or inverted dinner plate on top of cabbage, then add a weight on top.
0f741c9b-4a64-4004-aa71-45a1fadb6ab1 Let ferment for 3 days.
0f741c9b-4a64-4004-aa71-45a1fadb6ab1 Drain and squeeze out the salty water.
0f741c9b-4a64-4004-aa71-45a1fadb6ab1 Soak dry seaweed for 30 minutes in warm water. Drain and squeeze out water.
0f741c9b-4a64-4004-aa71-45a1fadb6ab1 Boil shrimp for 2 minutes. Cool in tap water, drain, then cut into smaller pieces.
0f741c9b-4a64-4004-aa71-45a1fadb6ab1 Mix seaweed with cabbage, shrimp, then pour rice wine over.
0f741c9b-4a64-4004-aa71-45a1fadb6ab1 Place a light weight and let ferment for 3 days.
0f741c9b-4a64-4004-aa71-45a1fadb6ab1 Store in refrigerator.
2d66989f-52ea-49ac-82e6-19795b08b656 Remove 2-3 outer cabbage leaves for later use. Cut the cabbage into 6-8 wedges. Don't remove the core, just trim off the tough part. The core holds the leaves together.
2d66989f-52ea-49ac-82e6-19795b08b656 Sprinkle a little salt into the bottom of the container or a bowl.
2d66989f-52ea-49ac-82e6-19795b08b656 Place cabbage wedges, cut sides up. Sprinkle more salt on cabbage.
2d66989f-52ea-49ac-82e6-19795b08b656 Pour over 1/2 cup (120 ml) of water.
2d66989f-52ea-49ac-82e6-19795b08b656 Place a lid or inverted dinner plate on top of cabbage, then add weight on top.
2d66989f-52ea-49ac-82e6-19795b08b656 Let ferment for 3 days.
2d66989f-52ea-49ac-82e6-19795b08b656 Drain and squeeze out the salty water.
2d66989f-52ea-49ac-82e6-19795b08b656 Mix with seaweed sheets and rice wine.
2d66989f-52ea-49ac-82e6-19795b08b656 Place weight on top and let ferment for 3 days.
2d66989f-52ea-49ac-82e6-19795b08b656 Store in refrigerator.
b932c43c-b557-491f-ba7f-948115e0e8fe Fermented turnip known also as "Sauerruben" is made exactly as sauerkraut.
b932c43c-b557-491f-ba7f-948115e0e8fe NOTE you may add a teaspoon of caraway or mustard seeds for flavor.
b932c43c-b557-491f-ba7f-948115e0e8fe Rinse turnips off to get rid of dirt but don't scrub the outside or peel the skin. There are microorganisms living on the outside of the beets that will start the fermentation process.
b932c43c-b557-491f-ba7f-948115e0e8fe Slice or grate turnips.
b932c43c-b557-491f-ba7f-948115e0e8fe Mix with salt.
b932c43c-b557-491f-ba7f-948115e0e8fe Pack. Place a weight on top.
b932c43c-b557-491f-ba7f-948115e0e8fe Ferment, preferably around 68° F (20° C), for about 2 weeks.
b40d08e7-bbb0-4de9-8b5b-e93909080128 NOTE After 3 days radishes taste great and may be packed and refrigerated.
b40d08e7-bbb0-4de9-8b5b-e93909080128 Rinse daikon off to get rid of dirt but don't scrub the outside or peel the skin. There are microorganisms living on the outside of the beets that will start the fermentation process.
b40d08e7-bbb0-4de9-8b5b-e93909080128 Slice radishes into thin strips or dice finely. Cut scallions into rounds. Mince garlic.
b40d08e7-bbb0-4de9-8b5b-e93909080128 Mix all ingredients with salt.
b40d08e7-bbb0-4de9-8b5b-e93909080128 Pack. Place a weight on top.
b40d08e7-bbb0-4de9-8b5b-e93909080128 Ferment, preferably around 68° F (20° C), for 7 days.
1586298b-504f-45b6-bc9d-891607b74f27 Remove outer leaves.
1586298b-504f-45b6-bc9d-891607b74f27 Cut cabbage in quarters, remove cores. They may be finely grated and added as well.
1586298b-504f-45b6-bc9d-891607b74f27 Mix cabbage with salt and spices and pack tightly in a container.
1586298b-504f-45b6-bc9d-891607b74f27 Cover with leaves and apply weight.
1586298b-504f-45b6-bc9d-891607b74f27 Ferment, preferably around 68° F (20° C), for about 3 weeks.
1443ece7-9ddf-4c9c-99b8-6d0355a06a33 Trim off outer leaves, cut the root, and split cabbage into separate halves.
1443ece7-9ddf-4c9c-99b8-6d0355a06a33 Make a brine: 3 cups salt to 4 quarts water. Brine the cabbage for 3 hours. Rinse cabbage in fresh water and squeeze the water out, repeat twice more. Drain cabbage for 30 minutes.
1443ece7-9ddf-4c9c-99b8-6d0355a06a33 Make red pepper paste. Cut radishes thinly into 1î (5 cm) long julienne strips. Coat strips with the paste.
1443ece7-9ddf-4c9c-99b8-6d0355a06a33 Cut scallions diagonally, dice ginger and crush garlic. Drain pickled baby shrimp.
1443ece7-9ddf-4c9c-99b8-6d0355a06a33 Mix all together.
1443ece7-9ddf-4c9c-99b8-6d0355a06a33 Pack the stuffing between the leaves. Wrap the stuffed cabbage with the outer layer of leaves.
1443ece7-9ddf-4c9c-99b8-6d0355a06a33 Pack stuffed cabbage in a container. Put on top outer leaves that were removed in step #1. Sprinkle with salt. Place weight on top. Ferment 3 days.
7547b5ca-8041-4eb7-998e-12d212daa18e Wash cucumbers. Cut 1/16-inch slice off blossom end and discard, but leave 1/4-inch of stem attached. Place whole cucumbers in suitable 1 gallon container. Add 1/4 cup canning or pickling salt to 2 quarts of water and bring to a boil. Pour over cucumbers. Add suitable cover and weight. Place clean towel over container and keep the temperature at about 70° F. On the third and fifth days, drain salt water and discard. Rinse cucumbers and rescald cover and weight. Return cucumbers to container. Add 1/4 cup salt to 2 quarts fresh water and boil. Pour over cucumbers. Replace cover and weight, and re-cover with clean towel. On the seventh day, drain salt water and discard. Rinse cucumbers and rescald containers, cover, and weight. Slice or strip cucumbers if desired, and return to container. Place celery seed and pickling spices in small cheesecloth bag. Combine 2 cups sugar and 4 cups vinegar in a saucepan. Add spice bag, bring to a boil and pour pickling solution over cucumbers. Add cover and weight, and re-cover with clean towel. On each of the next six days, drain syrup and spice bag and save. Add 1/2 cup sugar each day and bring to a boil in a saucepan. Remove cucumbers and rinse. Scald container, cover, and weight daily. Return cucumbers to container, add boiled syrup, cover, weight, and re-cover with towel. On the 14th day, drain syrup into saucepan. Fill hot sterile pint jars or clean hot quart jars, leaving 1/2-inch headspace. Add 1/2 cup sugar to syrup and bring to boil. Remove spice bag. Pour hot syrup over cucumbers, leaving 1/2-inch headspace. Remove air bubbles and adjust headspace if needed. Wipe rims of jars with a dampened clean paper towel. Adjust lids and process as below:
7547b5ca-8041-4eb7-998e-12d212daa18e Can be canned whole, in strips, or in slices.
e721a8bb-f7cf-4768-afb3-782df2bde637 Apple mint goes well with pork meat, for example pork chops.
e721a8bb-f7cf-4768-afb3-782df2bde637 NOTE use Granny Smith green apples.
e721a8bb-f7cf-4768-afb3-782df2bde637 Peel apples and remove cores and seeds. Cut into cubes.
e721a8bb-f7cf-4768-afb3-782df2bde637 Peel onions and chop finely.
e721a8bb-f7cf-4768-afb3-782df2bde637 Place apples and sugar in pot. Add sugar and salt. Let stand for 20 minutes.
e721a8bb-f7cf-4768-afb3-782df2bde637 Add vinegar, powdered mustard, clove, cinnamon, lemon zest and juice.
e721a8bb-f7cf-4768-afb3-782df2bde637 Boil gently until the mixture thickens. Stir often to prevent apples sticking to the bottom.
e721a8bb-f7cf-4768-afb3-782df2bde637 Cut mint into 1/4" sections and add in a last stage of cooking.
e721a8bb-f7cf-4768-afb3-782df2bde637 Remove clove and cinnamon sticks. Fill hot relish into 1/2 pint jars. Remove air bubbles. Tighten lids.
e721a8bb-f7cf-4768-afb3-782df2bde637 Place jars in a canner and bring water to a boil. Process at 212° F, 100° C for 10 minutes.
8937b892-59bd-484c-b936-8eecba45291d Apricot (or other plums) and apple chutney goes well with cold cuts, especially liver sausages and pates.
8937b892-59bd-484c-b936-8eecba45291d 1. Spice extract. Take a small skillet and add cinnamon stick, cloves, cardamom seeds and 125 ml (1/2 cup). Bring to a boil and simmer for 10 minutes without cover. Drain.
8937b892-59bd-484c-b936-8eecba45291d 2. Remove apricot pits. Add ½ sugar.
8937b892-59bd-484c-b936-8eecba45291d 3. Peel apples, remove cores and seeds and dice finely. Squeeze lemon to release juice. Grate lemon zest. Grate or finely chop fresh ginger.
8937b892-59bd-484c-b936-8eecba45291d 4. Heat olive oil and butter in a medium size skillet. Add onion and cook until glassy. Add apricots, apples, vinegar, and lemon juice and bring to a boil. Add spice extract, curry powder, ginger, lemon zest and remaining sugar and cook for 30 minutes over low heat. At the end of cooking add garlic.
8937b892-59bd-484c-b936-8eecba45291d 5. Fill glass jars to within ¼ inch from top, remove air bubbles and adjust lids.
8937b892-59bd-484c-b936-8eecba45291d 6. Process for 10 minutes in water bath canner.
8937b892-59bd-484c-b936-8eecba45291d 7. Remove from canner and let stand for 12 hours.
bc88f969-99ea-4de2-bf00-8ad40cb828be Beet and horseradish goes well with cold cuts, especially beef.
bc88f969-99ea-4de2-bf00-8ad40cb828be NOTE use Granny Smith green apples.
bc88f969-99ea-4de2-bf00-8ad40cb828be Peel apples and remove cores and seeds. Dice into cubes.
bc88f969-99ea-4de2-bf00-8ad40cb828be Peel and dice beets.
bc88f969-99ea-4de2-bf00-8ad40cb828be Peel onions and chop finely.
bc88f969-99ea-4de2-bf00-8ad40cb828be Grate horseradish.
bc88f969-99ea-4de2-bf00-8ad40cb828be Except horseradish, place all ingredients in a pot. Mix and let stand for 20 minutes.
bc88f969-99ea-4de2-bf00-8ad40cb828be Boil gently until the mixture thickens. Stir often to prevent apples sticking to the bottom.
bc88f969-99ea-4de2-bf00-8ad40cb828be Switch the heat off, add horseradish and mix all together.
bc88f969-99ea-4de2-bf00-8ad40cb828be Fill hot relish into 1/2 pint jars. Remove air bubbles. Tighten lids.
bc88f969-99ea-4de2-bf00-8ad40cb828be Place jars in a canner and bring water to a boil. Process at 212° F, 100° C for 10 minutes.
5c20a54f-6707-478a-b454-e968ed4eb6e6 Wash cucumbers. Cut 1/16-inch off blossom end and discard. Cut into 3/16-inch slices. Combine cucumbers and onions in a large bowl. Add salt. Cover with 2 inches crushed or cubed ice. Refrigerate 3 to 4 hours, adding more ice as needed. Combine remaining ingredients in a large pot. Boil 10 minutes. Drain and add cucumbers and onions and slowly reheat to boiling. Fill hot pint jars with slices and cooking syrup, leaving 1/2-inch headspace. Remove air bubbles and adjust headspace if needed. Wipe rims of jars with a dampened clean paper towel. Adjust lids and process as below:
d46f3a04-b5dd-4b5a-a20b-088775ad4295 Place cabbage, cucumbers, tomatoes and onions in brine (1 gal of water & 2 cups salt) overnight. Drain.
d46f3a04-b5dd-4b5a-a20b-088775ad4295 Mix all vegetables with remaining ingredients and boil for 10 minutes.
d46f3a04-b5dd-4b5a-a20b-088775ad4295 Pack hot into hot pint jars, leaving 1/2 inch headspace. Remove air bubbles, wipe jar rims. Place lids and screw bands. Process 10 minutes in a Boiling Water Bath.
f1968eac-5239-456c-aa47-02ee5e2721b0 Add cucumbers, peppers, onions, salt, and ice to water and let stand 4 hours. Drain and re-cover vegetables with fresh ice water for another hour. Drain again. Combine spices in a spice or cheesecloth bag. Add spices to sugar and vinegar. Heat to boiling and pour mixture over vegetables. Cover and refrigerate 24 hours. Heat mixture to boiling and fill hot into hot jars, leaving 1/2 inch headspace. Remove air bubbles and adjust headspace if needed. Wipe rims of jars with a dampened clean paper towel. Adjust lids and process.
318ea02b-0840-41bc-9508-d5c9f43e5cab Cucumber relish is very popular with sausages, look what carries every hotdog vendor in New York: ketchup, mustard, sauerkraut and cucumber relish.
318ea02b-0840-41bc-9508-d5c9f43e5cab Except dill, place all ingredients in pot, mix and leave for 20 minutes.
318ea02b-0840-41bc-9508-d5c9f43e5cab Bring to a boil and simmer until mixture is thicker. Add chopped dill at the end of cooking process.
318ea02b-0840-41bc-9508-d5c9f43e5cab Fill hot relish into 1/2 pint jars. Remove air bubbles. Tighten lids.
318ea02b-0840-41bc-9508-d5c9f43e5cab Place jars in a canner and bring water to a boil. Process at 212° F, 100° C for 10 minutes.
4a79ada7-e738-4160-9763-4e0c54a543e4 Wash cucumbers. Cut 1/16-inch slice off blossom end and discard. Leave 1/4-inch of stem attached. Place half of dill and spices on bottom of a clean, suitable container. Add cucumbers, remaining dill, and spices. Dissolve salt in vinegar and water and pour over cucumbers. Add suitable cover and weight. Store where temperature is between 70 and 75° F for about 3 to 4 weeks while fermenting. Temperatures of 55 to 65° F are acceptable, but the fermentation will take 5 to 6 weeks. Avoid temperatures above 80° F, or pickles will become too soft during fermentation. Fermenting pickles cure slowly. Check the container several times a week and promptly remove surface scum or mold.
4a79ada7-e738-4160-9763-4e0c54a543e4 CAUTION If the pickles become soft, slimy, or develop a disagreeable odor, discard them. Fully fermented pickles may be stored in the original container for about 4 to 6 months, provided they are refrigerated and surface scum and molds are removed regularly. Canning fully fermented pickles is a better way to store them. To can them, pour the brine into a pan, heat slowly to a boil, and simmer 5 minutes. Filter brine through paper coffee filters to reduce cloudiness, if desired. Fill hot jar with pickles and hot brine, leaving 1/2-inch headspace. Remove air bubbles and adjust headspace if needed. Wipe rims of jars with a dampened clean paper towel. Adjust lids and process as below:
4a79ada7-e738-4160-9763-4e0c54a543e4 Use the following quantities for each gallon capacity of your container.
1fc55299-74d0-4289-8210-d0a0a17ca100 Lithuanian Beet Cooler Soup is made of beet stocks, beets, dill, scallions, cucumbers, plain yoghurt or sour cream. It looks very pretty and is delicious. The soup is served cold and originally was made with river crayfish. As the soup becomes famous and popular, new cooks start to put anything inside thinking they have created a new masterpiece, as long as the characteristic pink color of the soup is preserved.
1fc55299-74d0-4289-8210-d0a0a17ca100 NOTE Ukrainian borscht is another known beet soup.
1fc55299-74d0-4289-8210-d0a0a17ca100 Lithuanian Beet Cooler Soup can be made from Fermented Borscht.
1fc55299-74d0-4289-8210-d0a0a17ca100 Wash and separate beets from stalks. Peel beets and dice finely. Chop stalks with leaves into ¼ inch pieces. Use of leaves is optional, often people take only half of them.
1fc55299-74d0-4289-8210-d0a0a17ca100 Place chopped beets and stems in pot, add lemon juice, add water just over the beets level. Cook overlow heat for 15 minutes. Let it cool.
1fc55299-74d0-4289-8210-d0a0a17ca100 Peel cucumbers and dice finely. Place into a mixing bowl. Finely cut scallions and dill. Add to cucumbers. Add yoghurt and mix together.
1fc55299-74d0-4289-8210-d0a0a17ca100 Add cooked beets and mix everything together.
1fc55299-74d0-4289-8210-d0a0a17ca100 Pour into serving bowls and garnish with sliced hard boiled eggs.
4e292926-a477-4dd6-b4fe-059646c8eb74 Wash, peel, and separate mango flesh from seed. Chop mango flesh into chunks and puree in blender or food processor until smooth. Combine all ingredients in a 6 to 8 quart Dutch oven or stockpot and heat on medium high heat, with continuous stirring, until the mixture reaches 200° F. The mixture will sputter as it is being heated, so be sure to wear gloves or oven mitts to avoid burning skin. Fill hot sauce into hot half pint jars, leaving 1/4 inch headspace. Remove air bubbles and adjust headspace if needed. Wipe rims of jars with a dampened clean paper towel. Adjust lids and process.
4e292926-a477-4dd6-b4fe-059646c8eb74 CAUTION Handling green mangoes may irritate the skin of some people in the same way as poison ivy. (They belong to the same plant family.) To avoid this reaction, wear plastic or rubber gloves while working with raw green mango. Do not touch your face, lips or eyes after touching or cutting raw green mangoes until all traces are washed away. Yield: About 6 half pint jars.
7bf3599d-88eb-439b-852f-33a0ea23bfad This recipe may be made with any combination of peaches, nectarines, apricots, and plums.
7bf3599d-88eb-439b-852f-33a0ea23bfad This recipe may be made without sugar or with up to 2 cups, according to taste or preference. Non-nutritive sweeteners may be added. If aspartame (a low-calorie nutritive sweetener) is used, the sweetening power of aspartame may be lost within 3 to 4 weeks.
7bf3599d-88eb-439b-852f-33a0ea23bfad Yield: 5 to 6 half-pints
7bf3599d-88eb-439b-852f-33a0ea23bfad Procedure: Thoroughly wash 4 to 6 pounds of firm, ripe peaches. Drain well. Peel and remove pits. Grind fruit flesh with a medium or coarse blade, or crush with a fork (do not use a blender). Place ground or crushed fruit in a 2 quart saucepan. Heat slowly to release juice, stirring constantly, until fruit is tender. Place cooked fruit in a jelly bag or strainer lined with four layers of cheesecloth. Allow juice to drip about 15 minutes. Save the juice for jelly or other uses. Measure 4 cups of drained fruit pulp for making spread. Combine the 4 cups of pulp, pineapple, and lemon juice in a 4 quart saucepan. Add up to 2 cups of sugar, if desired, and mix well. Heat and boil gently for 10 to 15 minutes, stirring enough to prevent sticking. Fill hot jars quickly, leaving 1/4 inch headspace. Wipe rims of jars with a dampened clean paper towel. Adjust lids and process.
b447e361-993a-41a2-9f63-dffd97056ea3 Procedure: Crush apples and pears in a large saucepan and stir in cinnamon. Thoroughly mix sugar and lemon juice with fruits and bring to a boil over high heat, stirring constantly. Immediately stir in pectin. Bring to a full rolling boil and boil hard 1 minute, stirring constantly. Remove from heat, quickly skim off foam, and fill sterile jars (see page 1-14) leaving 1/4-inch headspace. Wipe rims of jars with a dampened clean paper towel. Adjust lids and process.
38b33330-6f5a-472c-aea5-fcc61e5c2fe8 Wash, chop, and combine vegetables with 1/2 cup salt. Cover with hot water and let stand 12 hours. Drain and press in a clean white cloth to remove all possible liquid. Tie spices loosely in a spice bag and add to combined vinegar and brown sugar and heat to a boil in a sauce pan. Add vegetables and boil gently 30 minutes or until the volume of the mixture is reduced by one half. Remove spice bag. Fill hot sterile jars with hot mixture, leaving 1/2 inch headspace. Remove air bubbles and adjust headspace if needed. Wipe rims of jars with a dampened clean paper towel. Adjust lids and process.
cc7d01f8-aee1-470c-a1c6-48cda7fb7252 Trim off beet tops, leaving 1 inch of stem and roots to prevent bleeding of color. Wash thoroughly. Sort for size. Cover similar sizes together with boiling water and cook until tender (about 25 to 30 minutes). Caution: Drain and discard liquid. Cool beets. Trim off roots and stems and slip off skins. Slice into 1/4 inch slices. Peel and thinly slice onions. Combine vinegar, salt, sugar, and fresh water. Put spices in cheesecloth bag and add to vinegar mixture. Bring to a boil. Add beets and onions. Simmer 5 minutes. Remove spice bag. Fill hot jars with beets and onions, leaving 1/2 inch headspace. Add hot vinegar solution, allowing 1/2 inch headspace. Remove air bubbles and adjust headspace if needed. Wipe rims of jars with a dampened clean paper towel. Adjust lids and process.
cc7d01f8-aee1-470c-a1c6-48cda7fb7252 Variation: For pickled whole baby beets, follow above directions but use beets that are 1 to 1-1/2 inches in diameter. Pack whole; do not slice. Onions may be omitted.
725efb26-1476-42ad-aec6-10a84afd9956 Wash and peel carrots. Cut into rounds that are approximately 1/2 inch thick. Combine vinegar, water, sugar and canning salt in an 8 quart Dutch oven or stockpot. Bring to a boil and boil 3 minutes. Add carrots and bring back to a boil. Then reduce heat to a simmer and heat until half cooked (about 10 minutes). Meanwhile, place 2 teaspoons mustard seed and 1 teaspoon celery seed into each empty hot pint jar. Fill jars with hot carrots, leaving 1 inch headspace. Fill with hot pickling liquid, leaving 1/2 inch headspace. Remove air bubbles and adjust headspace if needed. Wipe rims of jars with a dampened clean paper towel. Adjust lids and process.
cf2caa76-e211-475a-ab98-e5a12a41139f The pungency of fresh horseradish fades within 1 to 2 months, even when refrigerated. Therefore, make only small quantities at a time. Wash horseradish roots thoroughly and peel off brown outer skin. The peeled roots may be grated in a food processor or cut into small cubes and put through a food grinder. Combine ingredients and fill into glass jars, leaving 1/4 inch headspace. Seal jars tightly and store in a refrigerator.
ea0c9d4a-c066-435f-861e-a6c4329ac07e Wash cucumbers. Cut 1/16-inch slice off blossom end and discard, but leave 1/4 inch of stem attached. Dissolve 3/4 cup salt in 2 gallons water. Pour over cucumbers and let stand 12 hours. Drain. Combine vinegar, 1/2 cup salt, sugar, and 2 quarts water. Add mixed pickling spices tied in a clean white cloth. Heat to boiling. Fill hot jars with cucumbers. Add 1 tsp mustard seed and 1-1/2 heads fresh dill per pint. Cover with boiling pickling solution, leaving 1/2-inch headspace. Remove air bubbles and adjust headspace if needed. Wipe rims of jars with a dampened clean paper towel. Adjust lids and process as below:
92842dfb-7cf6-40df-91aa-7431ddc94cdf Wash cucumbers. Cut 1/16-inch off blossom end and discard, but leave 1/4 inch of stem attached. Slice or cut in strips, if desired. Place in bowl and sprinkle with 1/3 cup salt. Cover with 2 inches of crushed or cubed ice. Refrigerate 3 to 4 hours. Add more ice as needed. Drain well. Combine sugar, vinegar, celery seed, allspice, and mustard seed in 6-quart kettle. Heat to boiling.
92842dfb-7cf6-40df-91aa-7431ddc94cdf Add cucumbers and heat slowly until vinegar solution returns to boil. Stir occasionally to make sure mixture heats evenly. Fill sterile jars, leaving 1/2-inch headspace.
92842dfb-7cf6-40df-91aa-7431ddc94cdf Fill hot jars, leaving 1/2-inch headspace. Add hot pickling syrup, leaving 1/2-inch headspace.
92842dfb-7cf6-40df-91aa-7431ddc94cdf May be canned as either strips or slices
92842dfb-7cf6-40df-91aa-7431ddc94cdf Remove air bubbles and adjust headspace if needed. Wipe rims of jars with a dampened clean paper towel. Adjust lids and process as below:
92842dfb-7cf6-40df-91aa-7431ddc94cdf Variation for firmer pickles: Wash cucumbers. Cut 1/16-inch off blossom end and discard, but leave 1/4-inch of stem attached. Slice or strip cucumbers. Mix 1 cup pickling lime and 1/2 cup salt to 1 gallon water in a 2 to 3 gallon crock or enamelware container.
92842dfb-7cf6-40df-91aa-7431ddc94cdf CAUTION Avoid inhaling lime dust while mixing the lime water solution. Soak cucumber slices or strips in lime water solution for 12 to 24 hours, stirring occasionally. Remove from lime solution and rinse and resoak 1 hour in fresh cold water. Repeat the rinsing and resoaking two more times. Handle carefully because slices or strips will be brittle. Drain well.
92842dfb-7cf6-40df-91aa-7431ddc94cdf NOTES
cf88672d-2dd3-4614-aa1c-ae5ca033bded Wash cucumbers. Cut 1/16-inch slice off blossom end and discard, but leave 1/4-inch of stem attached. Place cucumbers in large container and cover with boiling water. Six to 8 hours later, and again on the second day, drain and cover with 6 quarts of fresh boiling water containing 1/4 cup salt. On the third day, drain and prick cucumbers with a table fork. Combine and bring to a boil 3 cups vinegar, 3 cups sugar, turmeric, and spices. Pour over cucumbers. Six to 8 hours later, drain and save the pickling syrup. Add another 2 cups each of sugar and vinegar and reheat to boil. Pour over pickles. On the fourth day, drain and save syrup. Add another 2 cups sugar and 1 cup vinegar. Heat to boiling and pour over pickles. Drain and save pickling syrup 6 to 8 hours later. Add 1 cup sugar and 2 tsp vanilla and heat to boiling. Fill hot sterile pint jars with pickles and cover with hot syrup, leaving 1/2-inch headspace. Remove air bubbles and adjust headspace if needed. Wipe rims of jars with a dampened clean paper towel. Adjust lids and process as below:
ef67250f-0d43-4600-b8bd-ce5ca13edf90 Tomato relish goes well with dark meats, especially beef. It adds strong flavor to wild game meat and can be added to hamburgers as well.
ef67250f-0d43-4600-b8bd-ce5ca13edf90 Place tomatoes briefly in hot water, rinse with cold water and peel the skin off. Dice into small cubes.
ef67250f-0d43-4600-b8bd-ce5ca13edf90 Peel apples, remove blossom ends and cores. Dice finely.
ef67250f-0d43-4600-b8bd-ce5ca13edf90 Dice finely red peppers and onions. Smash garlic cloves.
ef67250f-0d43-4600-b8bd-ce5ca13edf90 Place above described materials in skillet, add vinegar and tomato sauce. Bring to a boil and cook on low heat for 30 minutes under cover.
ef67250f-0d43-4600-b8bd-ce5ca13edf90 Add all remaining ingredients, bring to a boil and cook on low heat for 5 more minutes.
ef67250f-0d43-4600-b8bd-ce5ca13edf90 Fill hot relish into ½ pint jars. Remove air bubbles. Tighten lids.
ef67250f-0d43-4600-b8bd-ce5ca13edf90 Place jars in a canner and bring water to a boil. Process at 212 F, 100 C for 15 minutes.
ef67250f-0d43-4600-b8bd-ce5ca13edf90 Remove jars from the canner and let stand for 12 hours.
6ae15556-50d3-4f5c-a046-6300224a2e1a White button mushroom and the large portabella mushrooms are the varieties of Agaricus bisporusspecies.
6ae15556-50d3-4f5c-a046-6300224a2e1a Wash and clean mushrooms. Cook in water for 10 minutes adding 1 teaspoon of salt. Drain.
6ae15556-50d3-4f5c-a046-6300224a2e1a Peel and slice carrots and onions. Slice into discs.
6ae15556-50d3-4f5c-a046-6300224a2e1a Marinade. Mix vinegar, water, salt and sugar and bring to a boil. Add onions and carrots. Cook over low heat for 5 minutes.
6ae15556-50d3-4f5c-a046-6300224a2e1a Fill jars with mushrooms. Insert to each jar a slice of onion, sliced carrots, allspice berry, bay leaf, a fewblack peppercorns and 12 mustard seeds. Fill jars to within 1 inch from the top.
6ae15556-50d3-4f5c-a046-6300224a2e1a Pour hot marinade into each jar to cover mushrooms. Leave 1/2 inch headspace. Remove air bubbles and adjust lids.
6ae15556-50d3-4f5c-a046-6300224a2e1a Process for 20 minutes in water bath canner.
6ae15556-50d3-4f5c-a046-6300224a2e1a Remove jars and let stand for 12 hours.
dac115dd-a526-4e21-bdc6-f9c6724d2680 The same marinade may be used for pickling different types of wild mushrooms. Small mushrooms can be pickled whole, large mushrooms must be halved or quartered.
dac115dd-a526-4e21-bdc6-f9c6724d2680 Wash and clean mushrooms. Pay attention to stems, cut a part of the bottom of the stem if necessary. Cook in water for 10 minutes adding 1 tablespoon of salt. Drain.
dac115dd-a526-4e21-bdc6-f9c6724d2680 Peel the onions and slice into discs.
dac115dd-a526-4e21-bdc6-f9c6724d2680 Marinade. Mix vinegar, water, salt and sugar and bring to a boil.
dac115dd-a526-4e21-bdc6-f9c6724d2680 Fill jars with mushrooms. Insert to each jar a slice of onion, garlic clove, allspice berry, bay leaf, a few black peppercorns and 12 mustard seeds. Fill jars to within 1 inch from the top.
dac115dd-a526-4e21-bdc6-f9c6724d2680 Pour hot marinade into each jar to cover mushrooms. Leave 1/2 inch headspace. Remove air bubbles and adjust lids.
dac115dd-a526-4e21-bdc6-f9c6724d2680 Process for 20 minutes in water bath canner.
dac115dd-a526-4e21-bdc6-f9c6724d2680 Remove jars and let stand for 12 hours.
77fcfa59-3399-46c9-8ba0-4bcd1d127cf3 Use electric blender and eliminate need for pressing or sieving.
77fcfa59-3399-46c9-8ba0-4bcd1d127cf3 Yield: About 9 pints
77fcfa59-3399-46c9-8ba0-4bcd1d127cf3 Procedure: Wash tomatoes and dip in boiling water for 30 to 60 seconds or until skins split. Then dip in cold water, slip off skins, core, and quarter. Remove seeds from peppers and slice into strips. Peel and quarter onions. Blend tomatoes, peppers, and onions at high speed for 5 seconds in electric blender. Pour into a 3- to 4-gallon stock pot or large kettle and heat. Boil gently 60 minutes, stirring frequently. Add vinegar, sugar, salt, and a spice bag containing dry mustard, red pepper, and other spices. Continue boiling and stirring until volume is reduced one-half and ketchup rounds up on a spoon with no separation of liquid and solids. Remove spice bag and fill hot jars, leaving 1/8-inch headspace. Remove air bubbles and adjust head- space if needed. Wipe rims of jars with a dampened clean paper towel. Adjust lids and follow process times for regular regular ketchup.
76e3d2c9-1d5c-431d-8b46-4ef984d3f417 Yield: About 5 pints
76e3d2c9-1d5c-431d-8b46-4ef984d3f417 CAUTION Wear plastic or rubber gloves and do not touch your face while han- dling or cutting hot peppers. If you do not wear gloves, wash hands thoroughly with soap and water before touching your face or eyes.
76e3d2c9-1d5c-431d-8b46-4ef984d3f417 Procedure: Wash, trim and slice peppers and onions into rings, using a mandolin slicer or a food processor. In a 10-quart Dutch oven or stockpot, mix together all ingredients. Bring to a boil and boil 1 hour. Reduce heat slightly and simmer 1 additional hour. Turn heat off, and cool mixture slightly. Puree vegetables in a blender about 2 minutes per blender batch. Return pureed mixture to stockpot and bring carefully just to a boil. (The mixture will start to spatter as it gets close to boiling; heat slowly while stirring constantly, being careful not to get burned by splashing sauce.) Turn off heat. Fill hot sauce into hot pint jars, leaving 1/2-inch headspace. Remove air bubbles and adjust headspace if needed. Wipe rims of jars with a dampened clean paper towel. Adjust lids and process.
2209500e-494f-4f05-afb9-15dda31ec108 Yield: About 6 to 8 pints
2209500e-494f-4f05-afb9-15dda31ec108 CAUTION Wear plastic or rubber gloves and do not touch your face while handling or cutting hot peppers. If you do not wear gloves, wash hands thoroughly with soap and water before touching your face or eyes.
2209500e-494f-4f05-afb9-15dda31ec108 Peel and prepare peppers
2209500e-494f-4f05-afb9-15dda31ec108 Wash and dry peppers; slit each pepper along the side to allow steam to escape. Blister skins using one of these two methods:
2209500e-494f-4f05-afb9-15dda31ec108 Oven or broiler method to blister skins - Place peppers in a hot oven (400° F) or under a broiler for 6 to 8 minutes until skins blister.
2209500e-494f-4f05-afb9-15dda31ec108 Range-top method to blister skins - Cover hot burner (either gas or electric) with heavy wire mesh. Place peppers on burner for several minutes until skins blister.
2209500e-494f-4f05-afb9-15dda31ec108 To peel, after blistering skins, place peppers in a pan and cover with a damp cloth. (This will make peeling the peppers easier.) Cool several minutes; peel off skins. Discard seeds and chop.
2209500e-494f-4f05-afb9-15dda31ec108 Procedure: Wash tomatoes and dip in boiling water for 30 to 60 seconds or until skins split. Dip in cold water, slip off skins, and remove cores. Coarsely chop tomatoes and combine them with chopped peppers, onions, and remaining ingredients in a large saucepan. Heat to boil, reduce heat and simmer 10 minutes. Fill hot jars, leaving 1/2-inch headspace. Remove air bubbles and adjust headspace if needed. Wipe rims of jars with a dampened clean paper towel. Adjust lids and process.
05b9e2c1-497c-4850-8777-15a032c5d9b8 Yield: About 7 to 9 pints
05b9e2c1-497c-4850-8777-15a032c5d9b8 CAUTION Wear plastic or rubber gloves and do not touch your face while handling or cutting hot peppers. If you do not wear gloves, wash hands thoroughly with soap and water before touching your face or eyes.
05b9e2c1-497c-4850-8777-15a032c5d9b8 Peel and prepare peppers
05b9e2c1-497c-4850-8777-15a032c5d9b8 Wash and dry peppers; slit each pepper along the side to allow steam to escape. Blister skins using one of these two methods:
05b9e2c1-497c-4850-8777-15a032c5d9b8 Oven or broiler method to blister skins - Place peppers in a hot oven (400° F) or under a broiler for 6 to 8 minutes until skins blister.
05b9e2c1-497c-4850-8777-15a032c5d9b8 Range-top method to blister skins - Cover hot burner (either gas or electric) with heavy wire mesh. Place peppers on burner for several minutes until skins blister.
05b9e2c1-497c-4850-8777-15a032c5d9b8 To peel, after blistering skins, place peppers in a pan and cover with a damp cloth. (This will make peeling the peppers easier.) Cool several minutes; peel off skins. Discard seeds and chop.
05b9e2c1-497c-4850-8777-15a032c5d9b8 Procedure: Wash tomatoes and dip in boiling water for 30 to 60 seconds or until skins split. Dip in cold water, slip off skins, and remove cores. Combine ingredients in a large saucepan. Heat to a boil and simmer 10 minutes. Fill hot salsa into hot pint jars, leaving 1/2-inch headspace. Remove air bubbles and adjust headspace if needed. Wipe rims of jars with a dampened clean paper towel. Adjust lids and process.
d8f46342-90a5-4723-9523-8d463a2f75aa A high-quality product, ideally suited for use in soups, stews, and casseroles. This recipe is similar to that formerly referred to as “Quartered Tomatoes.”
d8f46342-90a5-4723-9523-8d463a2f75aa Quantity: An average of 22 pounds is needed per canner load of 7 quarts; an average of 14 fresh pounds is needed per canner load of 9 pints. A bushel weighs 53 pounds and yields 17 to 20 quarts of crushed tomatoes—an average of 2-3/4 pounds per quart.
d8f46342-90a5-4723-9523-8d463a2f75aa Procedure: Wash tomatoes and dip in boiling water for 30 to 60 seconds or until skins split. Then dip in cold water, slip off skins, and remove cores. Trim off any bruised or discolored portions and quarter. Heat one-sixth of the quarters quickly in a large pot, crushing them with a wooden mallet or spoon as they are added to the pot. This will exude juice. Continue heating the tomatoes, stirring to prevent burning. Once the tomatoes are boiling, gradually add remaining quartered tomatoes, stirring constantly. These remaining tomatoes do not need to be crushed. They will soften with heating and stirring. Continue until all tomatoes are added. Then boil gently 5 minutes. Add bottled lemon juice or citric acid to jars. See acidifi- cation directions on page 3-5. Add 1 teaspoon of salt per quart to the jars, if desired. Fill hot jars immediately with hot tomatoes, leaving 1/2-inch headspace. Remove air bubbles and adjust headspace if needed. Wipe rims of jars with a dampened clean paper towel. Adjust lids and process. (Acidification is still required for the pressure canning options; follow all steps in the Procedures above for any of the processing options.)
ae0c7239-d825-4ebd-94e5-a089e249ec6c Yield: About 4 half-pints
ae0c7239-d825-4ebd-94e5-a089e249ec6c CAUTION Wear plastic or rubber gloves and do not touch your face while handling or cutting hot peppers. If you do not wear gloves, wash hands thoroughly with soap and water before touching your face or eyes.
ae0c7239-d825-4ebd-94e5-a089e249ec6c Procedure: Place mixed pickling spices in a spice bag and tie the ends firmly. Mix all ingredients in a Dutch oven or large saucepot. Bring to a boil, stirring occasionally. Simmer another 20 minutes, until tomatoes are soft. Press mixture through a food mill. Return the liquid to the stockpot, heat to boiling and boil for another 15 minutes. Fill hot sauce into hot half-pint jars, leaving 1/4-inch headspace. Remove air bubbles and adjust headspace if needed. Wipe rims of jars with a dampened clean paper towel. Adjust lids and process.
f9662f54-d4fd-463d-accf-7c607f1ae583 Yield: About 3 pints
f9662f54-d4fd-463d-accf-7c607f1ae583 CAUTION Wear plastic or rubber gloves and do not touch your face while handling or cutting hot peppers. If you do not wear gloves, wash hands thoroughly with soap and water before touching your face or eyes.
f9662f54-d4fd-463d-accf-7c607f1ae583 Peel and prepare peppers
f9662f54-d4fd-463d-accf-7c607f1ae583 Wash and dry peppers; slit each pepper along the side to allow steam to escape. Blister skins using one of these two methods:
f9662f54-d4fd-463d-accf-7c607f1ae583 Oven or broiler method to blister skins - Place peppers in a hot oven (400° F) or under a broiler for 6 to 8 minutes until skins blister.
f9662f54-d4fd-463d-accf-7c607f1ae583 Range-top method to blister skins - Cover hot burner (either gas or electric) with heavy wire mesh. Place peppers on burner for several minutes until skins blister.
f9662f54-d4fd-463d-accf-7c607f1ae583 To peel, after blistering skins, place peppers in a pan and cover with a damp cloth. (This will make peeling the peppers easier.) Cool several minutes; peel off skins. Discard seeds and chop.
f9662f54-d4fd-463d-accf-7c607f1ae583 Procedure: Wash tomatoes and dip in boiling water for 30 to 60 seconds or until skins split. Dip in cold water, slip off skins, and remove cores.
